newsitem.title: USA: KCBT wheat ends mostly higher on late spec buying.
newsitem.headline: KCBT wheat ends mostly higher on late spec buying.

text.p: KCBT hard red winter wheat futures settled mostly higher and well above their intraday lows on late speculative buying, traders said.

Wheat opened lower on follow-through technical selling from Monday's weak close and on pressure from Monday's crop progress reports, which contained improved ratings for HRW wheat in Texas, Oklahoma and Kansas.
The July contract fell as low as $4.16-3/4 per bushel Tuesday morning after support was breached at $4.20. But wheat firmed at the midsession as buying by local traders fueled a short-covering rally.
"The ensuing... rally was warranted from a technical standpoint and was also exaggerated by the fact that (CBOT) beans and corn moved higher on the day," a KCBT trader said.
Traders also said wheat values drew support from concern over ongoing dryness in western Kansas.
KCBT wheat settled four cents per bushel lower to eight cents higher, with new crop July up 3-3/4 cents at $4.28-1/4. May gained eight cents to settle at $4.58.
Featured players included commodity brokers FIMAT Futures, which bought two million July bushels. E. D. & F. Man International sold two million July bushels.
